event: Earliest evidence of human habitation in North America.
Norse explorer Leif Erikson reaches North America.
Christopher Columbus makes his first voyage to the Americas.
St. Augustine, Florida founded by the Spanish; oldest European settlement in the continental U.S.
Jamestown, Virginia founded as first permanent English settlement.
Pilgrims land at Plymouth, Massachusetts.
Start of French and Indian War (Seven Years’ War in North America).
Boston Tea Party protests British taxation policies.
Start of the American Revolutionary War.
Declaration of Independence signed on July 4.
British surrender at Yorktown, ending major fighting in Revolutionary War.
U.S. Constitution drafted in Philadelphia.
George Washington inaugurated as first President of the United States.
Louisiana Purchase doubles size of U.S. territory.
War of 1812 begins between the U.S. and Britain.
Missouri Compromise attempts to balance slave and free states.
Mexican-American War begins; ends in 1848 with U.S. acquisition of Southwest.
American Civil War begins.
Emancipation Proclamation issued by President Lincoln.
Civil War ends; Lincoln assassinated; slavery abolished by 13th Amendment.
15th Amendment grants African American men the right to vote.
Spanish-American War results in U.S. acquisition of Philippines, Guam, and Puerto Rico.
U.S. enters World War I.
19th Amendment grants women the right to vote.
Stock market crash triggers the Great Depression.
U.S. enters World War II after attack on Pearl Harbor.
U.S. drops atomic bombs on Hiroshima and Nagasaki; WWII ends.
Start of the Cold War; Truman Doctrine announced.
Brown v. Board of Education Supreme Court ruling desegregates schools.
Civil Rights Act prohibits discrimination based on race, color, religion, sex, or national origin.
Apollo 11 mission lands first humans on the Moon.
U.S. withdraws from Vietnam War.
Cold War ends with collapse of the Soviet Union.
September 11 terrorist attacks lead to War on Terror.
Barack Obama elected as first African American President.
COVID-19 pandemic causes major health and economic disruption.
Capitol riot occurs on January 6; Joe Biden inaugurated as 46th president.
